task-wr.title: Populating the Patch Storage Area
task-wr.shortdesc: US62817 changed wrs-patch -> sw-patchPatches have to be uploaded to the Titanium Server patch storage area before they can be applied.

step.cmd: Log in as wrsroot to the active controller.
CGTS-3092 removes requirement to log in as admin.Upload the patch file to the patch storage area.

info.p: This example uploads a single patch to the storage area. You can specify multiple patch files on the same command separating their names with spaces.
Alternatively, you can upload all patch files stored in a directory using a single command, as illustrated in the following example:

stepresult.p: The patch files are available now in the patch storage area, but they have not yet been applied to the cluster.

step.cmd: Verify the status of the patch.

codeblock.systemoutput: Patch ID Release Patch State ============== ======= =========== TITANIUM_15.12_PATCH_0001 15.12 Available

stepxmp.p: The patch state is Available now, indicating that it is included in the patch storage area. Further details about the patch can be retrieved as follows:

codeblock.systemoutput: TITANIUM_15.12_PATCH_0001: Patch State: Available Release Status: Released Summary: Add logs to hbsClient and libalarm-clock Description: Modified log in hbsClient. Expect to see this log on all blade types 'hbsClient patches by TITANIUM_15.12_PATCH_0001' when hbsClient restarts. Also added a log to ac_init() function that reads "TITANIUM_15.12_PATCH_0001 patched libalarm-clock". Should be seen when heartbeat process is restarted on controller and compute.
